name: tap water production, underground water with chemical treatment | tap water | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20495/documentation

This dataset is created as a child of the global dataset with edited production volume for this geography.;;This dataset represents production of 1 kg of tap water under pressure at facility gate, ready for distribution in network. It represents average operation of tap water from underground water with chemical treatments. Water is pumped from aquifer, chemically enhanced (e.g. corosion inhibitor, ph, chloration, etc.) and pressurized for distribution. Inventory was constructed from reported energy inputs and wastes from a single plant located in Québec assumed to represent 8% of total production of tap water from this technology.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - tap water production and supply, GLO, 2000 - 2000 (58c7c438-e3f3-49e2-a66c-e494dc0dbb20)]

From the intake pumping of raw surface water into the water treatment plant. 

This dataset ends with the production of tap water, at facility gate, under pressure. It includes energy for intake pumping, lighting and heating of the building as well as the energy of the pump pressurizing water to the beginning of the network. Infrastructure for the facility is estimated. It excludes energy for pumping stations and water losses within the network which is included in the tap water market. Emissions to the environment occurring during the treatment and during the distribution were not considered as they are assumed negligible. Main substance in water that would be released in the environment are assumed to be considered in wastewater processes.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is set from 2010 to the year 2017 as it is a considering period in which data has not passed through drastic changes.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Extrapolated from data from a single plant in Quebec (Canada).The uncertainty was adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From one underground water with chemical treatment tap water production facility in Quebec (Canada) to Indian average of same technology. Regionalization was based on the production volume, the remaining exchanges were copied from the global dataset.Underground water with chemical treatment accounts for 5.2% of the total produced tap water in India. The uncertainty has been changed accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on data collected from a treatment plant using underground water and chemical treatment in  Quebec (Canada). See corresponding Quebec dataset for more information. Note that percent representativeness is not supplied because technology-specific global production volumes is too uncertain. Should this information become available, the representativeness can be calculated by dividing the sum of the water treated by the Quebec plants that served as a basis for the Global dataset by the technology-specific global production volume. (9.74E9 kg/a)

exchanges.description: Calculated value taken from the "tap water production, underground water with chemical treatment, GLO" dataset (accessed 20170920) as it was considered adequate also for this dataset. exchanges.description: Measured value taken from the "tap water production, underground water with chemical treatment, GLO" dataset (accessed 20170920) as it was considered adequate also for this dataset. Average use of hypochlorite (dry basis) for disinfection in surveyed underground water with chemical treatment plants. Reported concentration of solution is 12% (w/w), input of exchange "water" was added accordingly. Note the 1 plants reported using this substance.
